perturbation.original_text: 3.  Term.  Subject to the other provisions contained herein, this AGREEMENT shall be for a term of thirty (30) years from the Effective Date, which shall automatically renew from year-to-year thereafter unless terminated by a Party upon sixty (60) days' written notice after the end of the term. Notwithstanding the 30-year term of this agreement, should STW procure sales agreements with customers for a duration of longer than 30 years, STW shall be authorized to maintain and service such contract(s) to the extent of the water volume(s) purchased, and this AGREEMENT shall not terminate during the initial term of any such water supply agreement with a term extending beyond this AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.  Term.  Subject to the other provisions contained herein, this AGREEMENT shall be for a term of thirty (30) years from the Effective Date. Renewal of the agreement is subject to negotiation and written agreement between both parties 60 days before the end of the term. Notwithstanding the 30-year term of this agreement, should STW procure sales agreements with customers for a duration of longer than 30 years, COFS has the right to terminate the agreement at the end of the 30 year term, regardless of STW customer contracts. If COFS allows the agreement to continue, the amount of water STW can sell will be subject to negotiation.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stated the contract auto-renews for additional 1-year terms, unless terminated with 60 days notice. The modified version says the contract does not automatically renew, instead requiring explicit renegotiation and agreement by both parties before the end of the initial term. In addition, COFS now has the right to terminate the contract even if STW has customer contracts in place.

perturbation.original_text: 11.  STW Termination Rights. STW shall have the right to unilaterally terminate the provisions of this AGREEMENT related only to the Property, and not proceed further after the completion of any phase of the project and not incur any additional costs. So long as STW is progressing through the following phases, and subject to the other terms of this AGREEMENT, COFS may not terminate the AGREEMENT during the:   a.  Pre-well study (ies),   b.  completion of improvements to the Existing CRA Well,   c.  completion of the Replacement CRA Well, if necessary, and   d.  Post-Well Study (ies).
perturbation.changed_text: 11.  STW Termination Rights. STW shall have the right to unilaterally terminate the provisions of this AGREEMENT related only to the Property, and not proceed further after the completion of any phase of the project and not incur any additional costs. STW needs to get the written consent of COFS before terminating the contract. So long as STW is progressing through the following phases, and subject to the other terms of this AGREEMENT, COFS may not terminate the AGREEMENT during the:   a.  Pre-well study (ies),   b.  completion of improvements to the Existing CRA Well,   c.  completion of the Replacement CRA Well, if necessary, and   d.  Post-Well Study (ies).
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that STW can unilaterally terminate the contract. The modified text creates contradiction by adding that STW now needs written consent from COFS before termination.

perturbation.original_text: 12.  Title of Producing Wells. Title and ownership of the Existing CRA Well, the Replacement CRA Well and any additional wells drilled on the Property by STW (the "Additional Wells") shall be transferred to STW by COFS and shall be held by STW; however, upon termination of the provisions of this AGREEMENT that relate to COFS Property, STW shall transfer the title(s) back to COFS upon COFS' reimbursement of STW as necessary under this AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.  Title of Producing Wells. Title and ownership of the Existing CRA Well, the Replacement CRA Well and any additional wells drilled on the Property by STW (the "Additional Wells") shall be transferred to STW by COFS and shall be held by STW. Title to all wells will always remain with COFS, and COFS has the right to take control of the wells upon written notice. However, upon termination of the provisions of this AGREEMENT that relate to COFS Property, STW shall transfer the title(s) back to COFS upon COFS' reimbursement of STW as necessary under this AGREEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause says that COFS will transfer title of the wells to STW. The modified text says title will always remain with COFS. This contradicts the first sentence, introducing uncertainty about who owns the wells and when ownership changes.
